poem:
Title: "Voices of Silence in Alabama"

In Alabama, the ice-cubes are children,
babies not yet teasing the wind.
They speak in riddles of what may be,
a hint of life within, unfathomed, raw.
Bells ring in closed clinics, a cold lullaby,
And a courier's hoof beats, arrested mid-gallop.
Yet, the question persists - 
who defines the genesis of a whisper, 
the dawn of a heartbeat?
